gurmukhi: ਰਘੁਬਰ ਲਛਮਨ ਪਰਹਰ ਬਾਨੰ ॥ ਗਿਰ ਤਰ ਅਾੲੇ ਤਜ ਅਭਿਮਾਨੰ ॥੨੮੩॥
transliteration: Raghoubar Lachman Parhar Baanan|| Gir Tar Aae Taj Abhimaanan||283||
translation: They abandoned their arrow and effacing their displeasure came down from the mountain.283.

gurmukhi: ਦਲ ਬਲ ਤਜਿ ਕਰਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਗਲ ਰੋੲੇ ॥ ਦੁਖ ਕਸਿ ਬਿਧਿ ਦੀਅਾ ਸੁਖ ਸਭ ਖੋੲੇ ॥
transliteration: Dal Bal Taj(i) Kar(i) Mil(i) Gad Roe|| Doukh Kas(i) Bidh(i) Deeaa Soukh Sabh Khoe||
translation: Leaving the army aside they hugged each other and wept. The providence had given such agony that they had lost all comforts.

gurmukhi: ਅਬ ਘਰ ਚਲੀੲੇ ਰਘੁਬਰ ਮੇਰੇ ॥ ਤਜਿ ਹਠਿ ਲਾਗੇ ਸਭ ਪਗ ਤੇਰੇ ॥੨੮੪॥
transliteration: Ab Ghar Chaleee Raghoubar Dere|| Taj(i) Hath(i) Laage Sabh Pag Dere||,284||
translation: Bharat said, “O Rahguvir, abandon your persistence and return to your home, because for this very reason all the people had fallen at your feet.”284.
Speech of Ram addressed to Bharat :

gurmukhi: ਭਰਥ ਕੁਮਾਰ ਨ ਅੳੁਹਠ ਕੀਜੈ ॥ ਜਾਹ ਘਰੈ ਨ ਹਮੈ ਦੁਖ ਦੀਜੈ ॥
transliteration: Bharath Koumaar Na Auhath Keejai|| Jaah Gdarai Na Hamai Doukh Deejai||
translation: “O Bharat ! do not be obstinate, go to your home, do not give me more anguish by staying here;

gurmukhi: ਕਾਜ ਕਹਯੋ ਜੁ ਹਮੈ ਹਮ ਮਾਨੀ ॥ ਤ੍ਰਿਯੋਦਸ ਬਰਖ ਬਸੈ ਬਨ ਧਾਨੀ ॥੨੮੫॥
transliteration: Kaaj Kahyo Ju Hamai Ham Maanee|| Triyodas Barakh Basai Ban Dhaanee||285||
translation: “Whatever permission has been given to me, I am acting according to that and accordingly I shall remain in the forest for thirteen years (and return in the fourteenth year).285.

gurmukhi: ਤ੍ਰਿਯੋਦਸ ਬਰਖ ਬਿਤੈ ਫਿਰਿ ਅੈਹੈਂ ॥ ਰਾਜ ਸੰਘਾਸਨ ਛੱਤ੍ਰ ਸੁਹੈਹੈਂ ॥
transliteration: Triyodas Barakh Bitai Phir(i) Aihain|| Raaj Sanhaasan Chhattra Suhaihain||
translation: “I shall return after thirteen years and sit on the throne under a canopy.

gurmukhi: ਜਾਹੁ ਘਰੈ ਸਿਖ ਮਾਨ ਹਮਾਰੀ ॥ ਰੋਵਤ ਤੋਰ ੳੁਤੈ ਮਹਤਾਰੀ ॥੨੮੬॥
transliteration: Jaahu Gdarai Sikh Maan Hamdaree|| Rovat Tor Outai Mahtdaree||286||
translation: “Listen to my instruction and return home, your mothers must be weeping there.”286.
Speech of Bharat addressed to Ram :

gurmukhi: ਜਾੳੁ ਕਹਾ ਪਗ ਭੇਟ ਕਹੳੁ ਤੁਹ ॥ ਲਾਜ ਨ ਲਾਗਤ ਰਾਮ ਕਹੋ ਮੁਹ ॥
transliteration: Jaao Kahaa Pag Bhet Kahau Tuh|| Laaj Na Laagad Raam Kaho Muh||
translation: “O Ram ! where should I go now after touching your feet? Shall I not be ashmed?

gurmukhi: ਮੈ ਅਤ ਦੀਨ ਮਲੀਨ ਬਿਨਾ ਗਤ ॥ ਰਾਖ ਲੈ ਰਾਜ ਬਿਖੈ ਚਰਨਾਮਤ ॥੨੮੭॥
transliteration: Mai At Deen Maleen Binaa Gad|| Raakh Lai Raaj Bikhai Charnaamat||287||
translation: “I am extremely low, dirty and motionless. O Ram ! manage your kingdom and glorify it with your ambrosial feet.”287.

gurmukhi: ਚੱਛ ਬਿਹੀਨ ਸੁੱਪਛ ਜਿਮੰ ਕਰ ॥ ਤਿੳੁ ਪ੍ਰਭ ਤੀਰ ਗਿਰਯੋ ਪਗ ਭਰਥਰ ॥
transliteration: Chachchh Biheen Soupachchh Jiman Kar|| Tio Prabh Teer Giryo Pag Bharthar||
translation: Just as a bird become sightless fells down, in the same way Bharat fell down before Ram.
